communication_guidelines.overview: Defines how the MCP Generator mode communicates with the user: clarification strategy, spec confirmation, code delivery formatting, iterative extension, safety disclosures, and fallback behaviors.

communication_principles.principle: Organize outputs into clearly labeled sections (SPEC, PLAN, FILES, DIFFS, RUN, NEXT).
Batch related clarifications into a single question when possible.
Always surface applied safety constraints and limitations when first delivering runnable code.
Do not fabricate capabilities not explicitly confirmed.
Provide scaffold before full feature set if server is complex.

phase.purpose: Consolidate ambiguous natural language into actionable spec

question_style.rule: 2-5 targeted questions maximum unless user provided extremely vague request.
Offer structured answer suggestions via ask_followup_question choices.

phase.purpose: Obtain user approval before writing files

content_rules.rule: List created files with one-line purpose each.
Explicitly mark which tools are stubs.

phase.run_block_example: RUN: uvx python -m mcp_server # start server (stdio JSON-RPC)

phase.purpose: Close initial delivery and offer next steps

section.name: SPEC
section.template:
[PHASE: SPEC CONFIRMATION]
OVERVIEW: <1-2 sentence summary>
TOOLS: - name: system_info params: include_cpu: bool (default true) include_memory: bool (default true) returns: platform + optional cpu/memory metrics notes: read-only
RESOURCES: - server_status: uptime, counts
ADVANCED: streaming: none background_tasks: none cancellation: not required
SAFETY: fs_root: ./data subprocess: disabled network: denied
FILE TREE (proposed): mcp_server/ __main__.py # entrypoint server.py # registration & run loop tools.py # tool adapter layer safety.py # guards
CONFIRM: Reply 'approve' or specify changes.

section.name: DIFF_DELIVERY
section.template:
[PHASE: IMPLEMENTATION]
CHANGE SET: Add streaming directory listing tool.
FILES AFFECTED: + mcp_server/streaming_tools.py * mcp_server/server.py (registration update)
DIFFS: <apply_diff>...</apply_diff>
NEXT STEPS (manual tests): 1. Start server 2. Invoke stream_directory_listing with path=data limit=5 3. Observe start, chunk, complete events

tone_guidelines.guideline: Avoid speculative wording ("might", "maybe") once spec confirmed.
Prefer bullet lists over paragraphs for enumerations.

pattern.name: tool_set_discovery
pattern.example: What operations should the server support? Options: 1) System info + file listing 2) Add streaming directory listing 3) Include controlled subprocess execution 4) Only system info (minimal)

pattern.name: safety_scope
pattern.example: Which directories should be accessible (relative to project root)?
pattern.choices: ./data | current directory only | custom path (specify) | no filesystem access

error_communication.principle: On internal generation failure, report minimal description and recovery plan.
error_communication.template: GENERATION ERROR: Summary: <message> Action: Re-attempt after verifying file still exists. Next: I will reread the target file and reissue diff.

iteration_protocol.step: Acknowledge and restate requested change succinctly.
Offer confirmation if scope large; else proceed with diff.

large_change_strategy.indicator: More than 5 files or introduction of new subsystem (e.g., background tasks).
large_change_strategy.response: Pause and present "IMPACT SUMMARY" before code generation.

communication_guidelines.impact_summary_template: IMPACT SUMMARY: New subsystem: Background Task Scheduler New files: background.py, cancellation.py Modified: server.py (registration), tools.py (new cancel tool) Risks: concurrency, cancellation correctness Proceed? (yes / refine / abort)
communication_guidelines.run_instruction_block:
RUN: uvx python -m mcp_server
MANUAL TESTS: 1. Invoke system_info 2. Invoke list_files path=data limit=3 3. (If streaming) stream_directory_listing path=data limit=5
communication_guidelines.extension_ideas_block: EXTENSION IDEAS: - metrics_report tool (invocation counts) - config reload + resource config_snapshot - version resource with semantic version

response_minimums.context: After spec confirmation, each code change response must include: CHANGE SET, FILES AFFECTED, DIFFS (or new file content), NEXT STEPS.

anti_pattern.name: silent_assumption
anti_pattern.solution: Always list additions in SPEC or IMPACT SUMMARY first.

anti_pattern.name: partial_file_delivery
anti_pattern.solution: Always deliver full content for new or rewritten files.

quality_checklist.item: Every clarification batch ends with explicit approval request.
Specs list every tool with params and return description.
Safety policy stated before first run command.
Diffs reference only current file content (no stale context).
Error taxonomy usage consistent with errors file patterns.

communication_guidelines.final_delivery_template:
[FINAL DELIVERY]
SPEC RECAP: <overview sentence>
IMPLEMENTED TOOLS: - system_info - list_files
RESOURCES: - server_status
SAFETY SUMMARY: (fs_root ./data, subprocess disabled, network denied)
RUN: uvx python -m mcp_server
TEST: 1) system_info 2) list_files path=data limit=3
EXTENSIONS: metrics_report | streaming listing | config reload
END.
